description: Detailed design for a new marginal wharf structure at the Canadian Coast Guard College (CCGC), located in Westmount, Nova Scotia.
full_summary:
# Tender Notice

## Solicitation Title

EB144-241555 - Wharf Reconstruction Design CCGC

### Solicitation Reference Number

WS4401465017-Doc4401483488

## Tender Details

### Solicitation Method

 Competitive - Selective tendering

### Notice Type

Request for Proposal

### Procurement Category

Heavy Civil Engineering Services (Marine Engineering)

### Notice Publication Date

2024-01-18

### Tender Closing Date

2024-02-08 14:00:00

## Tender Requirements

### Request for Proposal

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) on behalf of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites proposals for the provision of detailed design for a new marginal wharf structure at the Canadian Coast Guard College (CCGC) in Westmount, Nova Scotia.

### Work Services

 The required services include the following:

* Design and detailed engineering services for a new marginal wharf structure
* Ensuring compliance with applicable standards and regulations
* Meeting the requirements outlined in the Supply Arrangement (SA) EB129-192368 Heavy Civil Engineering Services (Marine Engineering)

### Eligibility Criteria

* The proposer must be registered under the Supply Arrangement (SA) EB129-192368 Heavy Civil Engineering Services (Marine Engineering)
* The proposer must be an engineering firm experienced in the design and construction of marginal wharf structures

### Selection Criteria

* The selection will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price
* The bidder's technical proposal will be evaluated based on the qualifications and experience of their personnel

## Bidder Information

### Contracting Authority Contact

Grant, Stewart (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [stewart.grant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:stewart.grant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Additional Information

* Relevant sections of the Supply Arrangement (SA) EB129-192368 Heavy Civil Engineering Services (Marine Engineering) can be obtained by contacting the contracting officer.
* Delivery of the final tender will not be accepted after the tender closing date.

This tender notice provides a concise and organized overview of the requirements, selection criteria, and procedures for the provision of detailed design services for a new marginal wharf structure at the Canadian Coast Guard College in Westmount, Nova Scotia. The notice provides relevant information for potential bidders to enable them to prepare and submit their proposals effectively. Review the notice carefully before deciding to participate in
